    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      The start Method starts a Level. It initializes the Tilemap, Player and enemeies
      Angegeben von:
      start in Klasse javafx.application.Application
      Parameter:
      primaryStage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set. Applications may create other stages, if needed, but they will not be primary stages.

    • repeatBackground

      public void repeatBackground(javafx.scene.image.ImageView bg1, javafx.scene.image.ImageView bg2, double offsetX)
      Updates the position of two background images to create an infinite scrolling effect. As one background moves out of view, it is repositioned to the opposite side to repeat the background.
      Parameter:
      bg1 - The first background imageview
      bg2 - The second background imageview
      offsetX - The current horizontal scroll offset

    • setHeartImagesBasedOnHp

      public void setHeartImagesBasedOnHp()
      This function sets the player's heart images. The number of full hearts reflects the player's remaining lives. This function is only executed when the player's HP value changes.

    • getSelectedLevel

      public static int getSelectedLevel()

    • setSelectedLevel

      public void setSelectedLevel(int selectedLevel)

    • displayTimer

      public void displayTimer()
      Displays the timer on the screen by positioning and adding it to the game layer. Sets the timer's X and Y coordinates, assigns it an ID for styling purposes, and adds it to the specified game layer.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts the in-game timer that updates every second. Increments the total seconds since the start and updates the displayed timer text in "00:00" format, adding leading zeros for single-digit minutes and seconds.

    • checkActiveItems

      public void checkActiveItems()
      Checks if an item is active and, if so, verifies how long it has been running. If it runs for too long, the effect disappears.

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      stops the in-game timer

    • resumeTimer

      public void resumeTimer()
      resumes the in-game timer
